text: Psalm 116
Thanksgiving for God’s Deliverance
I love \add him\add*, because Yahweh has heard
⸤the voice of my supplications⸥.\f + \fr 116:1 \ft Literally “my voice, my supplications” \f*
Because he has inclined his ear to me,
I will call ⸤all my days⸥.\f + \fr 116:2 \ft Literally “in my days” \f*
\add The\add* ropes of death encircled me,
and the distresses of Sheol found me.
I found trouble and grief.
Then I called on the name of Yahweh:
“O Yahweh, please save my life!”
Gracious \add is\add* Yahweh and righteous,
and our God \add is\add* merciful.
Yahweh watches over \add the\add* simple.
I was brought low, but he gave me victory.
Return, O my soul, to your repose,
for Yahweh has dealt bountifully with you.
For you have rescued me\f + \fr 116:8 \ft Hebrew “my soul.” If “soul” is accepted, then “death” means “\fq the place of \ft death,” that is, the netherworld. \f* from death,
my eyes\f + \fr 116:8 \ft Hebrew “eye” \f* from tears, my feet from stumbling.
I will walk before Yahweh
in the land\f + \fr 116:9 \ft Hebrew “lands” \f* of the living.
I believed when I spoke,
“I am afflicted greatly.”
I said in my haste,
“⸤Everyone⸥\f + \fr 116:11 \ft Literally “All \fq of \ft the humankind” \f* \add is\add* a liar.”
What shall I give back to Yahweh
\add for\add* all his benefits to me?
I will lift up \add the\add* cup of salvation
and proclaim the name of Yahweh.
I will pay my vows \add made\add* to Yahweh
in the presence of all his people.
Costly ⸤in Yahweh’s view⸥\f + \fr 116:15 \ft Literally “in the eyes of Yahweh” \f* \add is\add*
the death of his faithful \add ones\add*.
Ah, Yahweh, I \add am\add* indeed your servant;
I am your servant, the child of your maidservant.
You have loosed my bonds.
I will offer to you a sacrifice of thanksgiving,
and proclaim the name of Yahweh.
I will pay my vows \add made\add* to Yahweh
in the presence of all his people,
in the courts of the house\f + \fr 116:19 \ft Or “temple” \f* of Yahweh,
in the midst of you, O Jerusalem.
Praise Yah!\f + \fr 116:19 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
